This is an [R Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) for Lines of Code Analysis Spring 2017. We fit a regression model between the predictor which is the lines of codes added and the novelty score / user requirement score at phase 5 as the outcome variable. 

## Notes 

> Significant tests show if a linear relationship exists but not the strength of the relationship. The coefficient of determination, R2, is a descriptive measure of the strength of the
regression relationship, a measure on how well the regression line fits the data. In general the
higher the value of R2, the better the model fits the data.
• R2 = 1: Perfect match between the line and the data points.
• R2 = 0: There are no linear relationship between x and y.
R2
is an effect size measure. Cohen (1988) defined some standards for interpreting R2
.
• R2 = .01: Small effect
• R2 = .06: Medium effect
• R2 = .15: Large effect.

```{r}
scores_loc <- read.table("/Users/jialincheoh/Downloads/overall_score_click_result.csv", header=TRUE, sep = ",")
scores_loc
```
## Overall without Subset 

```{r}
summary(lm(scores_loc$novelty.phase5~scores_loc$sum.add.loc))
```
## Interpretation: 

> Significant ( 1.02e-05 *** ) which means a linear relationship exists between the lines of codes added and the novelty score in phase 5 
> 0.1142 ( large effect ) based on Cohen (1988)


```{r}
summary(lm(scores_loc$user.requirement.phase5~scores_loc$sum.add.loc))
```
## Interpretation

> Significant ( 0.00543 **  ) which means a linear relationship exists between the lines of codes added and the user requirement score in phase 5 
>  0.04703 ( medium effect ) based on Cohen (1988)

## Visualization for Significant Effect for Bogota 1 and Bogota 2 [ Novelty Score ]

```{r}
scatter.smooth(bogota_2$sum.add.loc, bogota_2$novelty.phase5, lpars = list(col = "blue", lwd = 3, lty = 3))
abline(lm(bogota_2$novelty.phase5~bogota_2$sum.add.loc), col='red',lwd=3)
legend('topright', c('Linear','Smoothing'),
lty=c(1,2), lwd=c(3,3), col=c('red','blue'))
```

```{r}
scatter.smooth(bogota_1$sum.add.loc, bogota_1$novelty.phase5, lpars = list(col = "blue", lwd = 3, lty = 3))
abline(lm(bogota_1$novelty.phase5~bogota_1$sum.add.loc), col='red',lwd=3)

lty=c(1,2), lwd=c(3,3), col=c('red','blue'))
```

> Significant with medium effect size [ user requirement score ]
